radiographic_examinations.findings: Consolidation in the right lower lobe, large pleural effusion on the right side with evidence of loculation.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Seven months prior, chest radiograph showed clear lungs and no pleural effusion.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Asymmetry of the chest wall, thickening of the soft tissue of the right chest wall, consolidation in the right lower lobe and portions of the right middle lobe, large loculated pleural effusion, irregularly shaped parenchymal nodules in the right upper lobe, prominent enhancing ipsilateral axillary lymph nodes, and subtle periosteal elevation of the medial aspect of the right eighth rib.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up CT showed resolution of the chest-wall lesions, with residual pleural thickening and improving consolidation in the right lower lobe.
